  9. class UserMediaImageFormMixin(object):
  10. """
  11. Adds an `forms.ImageField` with name `user_media_image` to the form.
  13. Overrides `save()` and makes sure that the uploaded image get's tied
  14. to the content object instance.
  16. This is useful if you have a model form for your content object and you
  17. want to support uploading the user media image right from that form.
  19. Please make sure that your content object has a property called `user` that
  20. returns the user to which the content object belongs to.
  22. Currently it only supports one image per content object. On each subsequent
  23. upload, all other images of that content object will be deleted before the
  24. new image will be saved.
  26. The field name of the ImageField can be overridden by setting
  27. ``image_field_name`` on the form, that includes this mixin.
  29. """
  31. image_label = _('Image')
  32. require_user_media_image = False
  33. image_field_name = 'user_media_image'
  35. def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
  36. super(UserMediaImageFormMixin, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
  37. self.fields[self.image_field_name] = forms.ImageField(
  38. required=self.require_user_media_image,
  39. label=self.image_label,
  40. )
  42. def _delete_images(self, instance):
  43. """Deletes all user media images of the given instance."""
  44. UserMediaImage.objects.filter(
  45. content_type=ContentType.objects.get_for_model(instance),
  46. object_id=instance.pk,
  47. user=instance.user,
  48. ).delete()
  50. def save(self, *args, **kwargs):
  51. instance = super(UserMediaImageFormMixin, self).save(*args, **kwargs)
  52. umedia_image = self.cleaned_data[self.image_field_name]
  53. if umedia_image:
  54. self._delete_images(instance)
  55. image = UserMediaImage()
  56. image.user = instance.user
  57. image.content_type = ContentType.objects.get_for_model(
  58. instance)
  59. image.object_id = instance.pk
  60. image.image = umedia_image
  61. image.save()
  62. return instance

  81. def clean_image(self):
  82. """
  83. It seems like in Django 1.5 something has changed.
  85. When Django tries to validate the form, it checks if the generated
  86. filename fit into the max_length. But at this point, self.instance.user
  87. is not yet set so our filename generation function cannot create
  88. the new file path because it needs the user id. Setting
  89. self.instance.user at this point seems to work as a workaround.
  91. """
  92. self.instance.user = self.user
  93. data = self.cleaned_data.get('image')
  94. return data
